getWalkInConsentFormQuestions.message: List of consent form questions fetched successfully.

disclaimerData.disclaimer:
I am electing to receive Fractional CO2 Laser treatment and have been provided with the following details regarding the procedure:

What is Fractional CO2 Laser Treatment?

Fractional CO2 Laser treatment is a form of laser skin resurfacing that employs a carbon dioxide (CO2) laser to generate microscopic thermal columns within the skin. This technique eliminates damaged skin cells and promotes the generation of new cells, leading to smoother, firmer, and more uniform skin tone.

How is the Procedure Conducted?

During the Fractional CO2 Laser session, the physician or certified laser specialist will utilize a laser device to administer brief pulses of laser energy to the skin. This process will elevate skin temperature and remove the outermost layer, facilitating the formation of fresh skin tissue.

Is Fractional CO2 Laser Treatment Safe?

Fractional CO2 Laser treatment is generally regarded as safe; however, similar to all medical interventions, certain risks exist. Potential risks and side effects may include, but are not limited to:
•	Mild to moderate procedural discomfort
•	Post-procedural redness and swelling
•	Skin crusting or scab formation
•	Itching or skin flaking
•	Skin discoloration or pigment changes
•	Infection or scarring

These procedural risks will be explored more comprehensively during your consultation with the physician or certified laser specialist.
What to Anticipate During and After the Procedure?

Fractional CO2 Laser treatment will be performed with topical anesthetic cream to minimize discomfort. During the procedure, you may experience a warming or tingling sensation that may be uncomfortable but should not be painful.

Following the procedure, you can anticipate some redness and swelling, resembling mild to moderate sunburn, which typically subsides within several days. Crusting or scabbing may also occur but generally resolves within 5-7 days.

It is crucial to avoid sun exposure for a minimum of two weeks after treatment and to use broad-spectrum sunscreen with SPF 30 or higher. Refrain from using harsh skincare products, including alpha-hydroxy acids (AHA) and retinoids, for at least one week post-treatment.

I have reviewed and comprehend the information presented above concerning Fractional CO2 Laser Treatment. I have had adequate opportunity to ask questions, and all my inquiries have been addressed to my satisfaction. I understand the potential risks and benefits of the procedure and have chosen to proceed with treatment voluntarily.

questions.content: 1. Have you reviewed and completely understood the information contained in this consent form?
2. Do you have any questions or concerns regarding the procedure or its associated risks and benefits?
3. Have you previously experienced any adverse reactions or complications from laser treatments?
4. Do you have any medical conditions, such as diabetes or autoimmune disorders, that could affect your post-procedural healing?
5. Are you currently taking any medications, including blood thinners or acne treatments like isotretinoin, that might influence the procedure or recovery?
6. Have you had any recent skin infections, rashes, or cold sores on or near the treatment area?
7. Have you recently been exposed to sunlight or used tanning beds, self-tanning products, or spray tans on the area to be treated?
8. Are you currently pregnant or breastfeeding, or do you intend to become pregnant in the near future?
9. Have you received any recent cosmetic treatments, including facial peels, Botox injections, or dermal fillers, in the intended treatment area?

10. Are you prepared and capable of following all pre- and post-procedure instructions provided by the practitioner, including sun avoidance, use of prescribed skincare products, and abstaining from harsh skincare agents?
